answers.author: Maxwell Moline
answers.text:
Philip, 
The city of Montpelier, VT has a number of various weekly reports available on this part of their website:  http://www.montpelier-vt.org/page/366.html 
The list of these offers a good average layout for you to cross-reference with. Each report starts listing upcoming meetings, then other calendar dates, a list of status reports (followed by the actual reports at the end, public information, and then minutes from the previous council meeting. After that, the report gives briefings on various relevant topics that periodically vary--and then the aforementioned status reports are listed.  
If you'd like some more examples, the following are reports from various other cities: 
Monrovia, CA:  http://www.ci.monrovia.ca.us/about-monrovia/news-a-information/weekly-report 
Phoenix, AZ:  http://phoenix.gov/MGRREPT/index.html 
Temple City, CA: www.ci.temple-city.ca.us/CM%20Reports/.../2010-04-08%20CM%20Report.pdf 
Whitewater, WI:  http://www.ci.whitewater.wi.us/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=1478:city-manager-report-52110&catid=136:citymanager-blog&Itemid=515 
Tacoma, WA:  http://www.cityoftacoma.org/Page.aspx?nid=58 
I hope that helps! 
Max

answers.author: Scott Randall
answers.text:
There's nothing magical about the format -- I believe that creating an expectation among the elected officials is most important; as in, the weekly report should be your first read for it contains the information that you need to know.

answers.author: Jay Gsell
answers.text:
Phil- sorry for such a late reponse but as others have said it's the expectation and consistency not the format that electeds appreciate and look forward to. our weekly memos also include attachments to let Legislators know what is behind comments in Mgr's Brief and are now almost always emailed to Electeds to cut down on paper and usually get them to read it as part of weekend routine.

author: Philip Kiraly
text:
The Village of Northbrook is looking to improve our weekly reports from the Manager's office to the Village Board.  If you have a successful format that you utilize, I would appreciate it if you could send me a sample at kiraly@northbrook.il.us.  
Thank you in advance!
Phil Kiraly
Assistant Village Manager
